meanings.definition: The practice of deliberately delaying or preventing progress or action.
meanings.sent1: The obstructionism of the student council delayed the approval of the new school policy.
meanings.sent2: The senator's obstructionism in the debate hindered the passing of the bill.
meanings.sent3: The obstructionism of the traffic light made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like an invisible wall of obstructionism blocking any compromise.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of obstructionism loomed over the project, casting a shadow of delay and frustration.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in obstructive behavior.
meanings.sent1: The obstructionism of the student council delayed the approval of the new school policy.
meanings.sent2: The senator's obstructionism in the debate hindered the passing of the bill.
meanings.sent3: The obstructionism of the traffic light made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was like an invisible wall of obstructionism blocking any compromise.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of obstructionism loomed over the project, casting a shadow of delay and frustration.
